summary: researchers used two-dimensional gel electrophoresis (2-DE) and two-dimensional fluorescence difference gel electrophoresis (2-DIGE), coupled with matrix-assisted laser desorption/ionization time-of-flight tandem mass spectrometry (MALDI-TOF/TOF-MS) to explore proteome profiles of trachea and kidney tissues from chicken at different stages infected in vivo with the highly virulent ck/CH/LDL/ infectious bronchitis virus (IBV) was the first coronavirus to be discovered. it is a major poultry pathogen and is probably endemic in all chicken-raising regions. it has dramatic effects on host cell morphology, transcription and translation patterns, the cell cycle, cytoskeleton, suppression of interferon and apoptosis pathways. RNA viruses such as influenza virus, respiratory syncytial virus (RSV), parainfluenza virus (PIV), human metapneumovirus (hMPV), mouse hepatitis virus (MHV) provide invaluable information on the cellular signaling pathways involved in either the cellular response to viral infections. the in vivo infection model could yield more biologically relevant insights into pathogenesis. chickens exhibited respiratory clinical signs at about 4-14 dpi with the IBV ck/CH/LDL/97I P5 strain. clinical signs included tracheal rales, watery eyes, nasal mucus, and sneezing. chickens in the control group showed a negative serum antibody response. 5-infected group, virus was detected from trachea and kidney at 4, 7, 14 and 21 dpi. peak of viral copy number was at 4 dpi, then fell until 14 dpi, and only a little fluctuated at 21 dpi. both in trachea and kidney, the P115-infected group had the lower viral genome copies than P5-infected group. dpi; 1293 91, 1365 126, and 1220 56 protein spots were detected in gels from the control group, and P115-infected group at 14 dpi. 1204 91, 1236 42, and 1111 50 protein spots were detected in gels from the control group, and P115-infected group at 21 dpi. gels were scanned on a Typhoon 9400 scanner, and image analysis was performed with EttanTM DeCyder Software version v6.5. the protein spots identified were marked with circles and labeled with the respective Match ID listed in Tables 3 and 4. proteins in abundance. gene ontology annotation analysis of differentially expressed proteins according to their cellular component (A) and biological process (B) at 4 dpi, the mRNA level was up-regulated in the P5-infected group. by 7 and 14 dpi, the majority of the mRNA exhibited similar down-regulation in both the P5-infected group and the P115-infected group. however, by 7 dpi, infection with the P115 strain induced a stronger down-regulation than P115 infection. data represent means of three biological replicates per group. errors indicate standard error. samples were normalized with expression of the 18S ribosomal RNA gene. trends in mRNA levels of these genes were not completely consistent with changes patterns in 2-DE or 2-DIGE gels. chickens infected with the IBV ck/CH/LDL/97I P5 and ck/CH/LDL/97I P115 strain exhibited respiratory clinical signs at about 4-14 dpi. the clinical signs included tracheal rales, watery eyes, nasal mucus, and sneezing. antibodies appeared at 7 dpi and all of the chickens showed seroconversion after 14 dpi with both IBV strains. chickens in the non-inoculated control group showed a negative serum antibody response. analysis of viral load in the trachea and kidney of IBV-infected chickens was also verified using real-time RT-PCR. for the tracheal protein samples, Figure 2 shows representative images of the tracheal samples. 1366 39, 1536 126, and 1600 167 protein spots were detected in gels from the control group, and P115-infected group at 4 dpi. the differentially expressed protein spots identified vimentin, lamin-A, cartilage matrix protein, alpha-tropomyosin, nucleoside diphosphate kinase, sulfotransferase, and low molecular weight phosphotyrosine proteinphosphatase were induced to be differentially patterns changed in chickens infected with the P5 and P115 strains. this difference in the gene ontology annotation analysis of differentially expressed proteins according to their cellular component (A) and biological process (B). results were compared between trachea and kidney, P5-infected and P115-infected group, and different day's post-inoculation. mRNA level was up-regulated in the P5-infected group. at 21 dpi, the majority of mRNAs were still down-regulated in the P115-infected group. but the majority of mRNAs were still down-regulated in the P115-infected group. total RNA extracts were prepared from the trachea and kidney of chickens. abundance of HSPB1 was increased in trachea tissues from the P5-infected group at 4, 7 and 21 dpi, relative to the control group. abundance of annexin A2 was increased in tracheal tissues from the P5-infected group at 4 and 7 dpi, but decreased in tracheal tissues from the P5-infected group at 7 dpi. the abundance changed protein in trachea and kidney tissues from chicken infected in vivo with the highly virulent ck/CH/LDL/97I P5 strain of IBV and the embryo-passaged, attenuated ck/CH/LDL/97I P115 strain of IBV. some identified proteins are likely to be important in the host response to virus infection. vimentin is a major component of type III intermediate filaments that has been reported to be redistributed in cells around sites of virus replication and assembly during virus infection. infection with africa swine fever virus (ASFV) can lead to the rearrangement of vimentin into a cage surrounding a virus factory. the vimentin cage may provide a physical scaffold to facilitate the construction of the virus factory. annexins are a family of conserved proteins characterized by their ability to bind and order charged phospholipids in membranes, often in response to elevated intracellular calcium. ANXA2 is involved in various intra- and extracellular processes including signal transduction, anti-inflammatory processes, membrane trafficking, and ion channel activity. at 7 dpi with the highly virulent P5 strain of IBV was greater than that induced by the attenuated P115 strain. western blot analysis found that the abundance of the anti-oxidative protein MnSOD was significantly higher in highly virulent IBV ck/CH/LDL/97I strain infected group. HSPB1 has different cytoprotective roles, including acting as a molecular chaperone. it is involved in all phases of the viral life cycle, including cell entry, virion disassembly, viral genome transcription, replication and morphogenesis. abundance of HSPB1 was observed to be increased in IBV-infected Vero cells using stable isotope labeling with amino acids in cell culture. tricarboxylic acid (TCA) cycle, pentose phosphate pathway, and macromolecular biosynthesis. the rate of glycolysis in cells infected by poliomyelitis virus was increased by as much as 370%. some proteins involved in glycolysis, such as aldose reductase, pyruvate kinase, alpha-enolase, and triosephosphate isomerase, were found increased significantly in the early stage of we investigated the proteome profiles of tracheal and kidney tissues from chicken infected with highly virulent IBV ck/CH/LDL/97I P5 and embryo-passaged, attenuated IBV strain ck/CH/LDL/97I P115. some proteins involved in cytoskeleton organization, stress response, and anti-oxidative stress showed different change in abundance with IBV strains differing in virulence. experimental design Sixty-six one-day-old SPF White Leghorn chickens were divided randomly into three groups. chickens were inoculated with the IBV ck/CH/LDL/97I P5 strain and ck/CH/LDL/97I P115 strain. chickens were mock-inoculated in parallel with sterile allantoic fluid. RNA was extracted from 200 l tissue supernatant using TRIzol Reagent (Invitrogen) following manufacturer's instructions. one-step real-time RT-PCR reactions were performed using one step PrimeScript® RT-PCR kit. 100 mg tissue powder was dissolved in 500 l lysing solution containing 7 M urea, 2 M thiourea, 4% CHAPS, 40 mM DTT, 2% IPG buffer pH 3-10, 1% nuclease mix and 1% Protease Inhibitor Mix. the supernatant was collected and purified with the PlusOne 2D Quant Kit (GE Healthcare) three independent gels from the P5-infected and P115-infected groups were compared with those from the corresponding control group at 4, 7, 14 and 21 dpi respectively. the normalized volume values (vol %) of matched protein spots were subjected to Student's t test using the SPSS statistical software package version 16.0. Isoelectric focusing (IEF) was performed on an EttanTM IPGphor 3 (GE Healthcare) using the following protocol: 30 V for 12 h, 200 V for 2 h, 500 V for 2 h, 1000 V for 2 h, 8000 V for 3 h, and 65000 Vh. the second dimension separation was conducted on 12.5% SDS-polyacrylamide gels using an EttanTM DALT six system (GE Healthcare) gel samples were washed twice with 50 mM w/v NH4HCO3 and covered with 10 mg/ml Porcine Trypsin solution. the supernatant was removed into a second tube and 40 l 50 mM w/v NH4HCO3 was added. the gel was washed with 70% v/v ACN and dried in a Speed Vac (Vacuum Concentrator, Bachhofer) the peptide mass fingerprint (PMF) combined MS/MS data were submitted to MASCOT version 3.0 (Matrix Science) for identification according to the NCBInr database (release 16/01/2010, 10343571 sequences, 3528215794 residues) the search parameters were set as follows: Gallus, trypsin cleavage, carbamidomethylation of cysteine as fixed modification, oxidation of methionine as variable modification. each sample was amplified in triplicate using the 2-Ct method. samples from the control group at 4 dpi were used as the calibrator. samples from the control group at 4 dpi were used as the calibrator. experimental animals and infecting virus strains One-day-old white leghorn specific-pathogen-free chickens were obtained from the laboratory animal center. the chickens were maintained in isolators with negative pressure, and food and water were provided ad libitum. blood samples from 10 chickens in each group were collected at 4, 7, 14 and 21 days post inoculation. three chickens were selected randomly from each group and killed humanely at 4, 7, 14 and 21 days post inoculation. IBVF forward primer CTA TCG CCA GGG AAA TGT C, IBVR reverse primer GCG TCC TAG TGC TGT ACC C, IBV TaqMan® probe FAM-CCTGGAAACGGTAGACCCT-TAMRA. one-step real-time RT-PCR reactions were performed using one step PrimeScript® RT-PCR kit (Roche) 2-DE analysis of trachea protein samples Thirty-six samples of tracheal protein from the three groups (P5-infected, P115-infected and control) at 4, 7, 14 and 21 days post-inoculation (dpi) were analyzed by 2-DE using the methods previously described. the pH of the protein samples was adjusted to 8.5 and the protein concentration was adjusted to 5 g/l. the proteins were minimally labeled according to the manufacturer's instructions. the preparative gels were stained with 1200 g of unlabeled proteins. each spot of interest was matched with a Coomassie Blue R-350 image. the gel samples were washed twice with 50 mM w/v NH4HCO3. peptides were spotted on a MALDI plate and covered with 0.7 l of 2 mg/ml 3, 5-Dimethoxy-4-hydroxycinnamic acid matrix (Sigma) with 10 mM NH4H2PO4 in 60% ACN. five of the most intense ion signals, excluding common trypsin autolysis peaks, were selected as precursors for MS/MS acquisition. annotation of differentially expressed proteins Spot identities were submitted to GORetriever http://www.agbase.msstate.edu/ to obtain the GO annotations. if no annotation was returned, GOanna was used to retrieve annotations assigned on the basis of sequence similarities. the membranes were incubated with mouse monoclonal antibody to annexin A5 (sc-32321, Santa Cruz Biotechnology, USA), mouse monoclonal antibody to HSPB1 and goat polyclonal antibody to annexin A2 overnight at 4°C. -actin (sc-47778, Santa Cruz Biotechnology, USA) was used as a reference protein to check equal loading. authors declare that they have no competing interests. authors' contributions SL designed the study. authors declare that they have no competing interests. 5 Table S2 Biological function of differentially expressed proteins reported in viral infection.
